# intensity

**Instance Property**

A number between `0.0` and `1.0` that modulates the effect of the material property. Animatable.

## Declaration

```swift
var intensity: CGFloat { get set }
```

## Discussion

The default intensity is `1.0`. Reducing the intensity fades out the contents of the material property, causing different effects depending on which visual property of an [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNMaterial] object it represents:

- For the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNMaterial/normal] property, intensity varies the apparent roughness of the normal-mapped surface. Reducing intensity makes the surface appear more smooth.
- For the [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/SCNMaterial/multiply] property, reducing intensity blends the material property’s colors with white, effectively reducing the strength of the color multiplication effect.
- For all other properties, reducing intensity dims the material property’s contents.

You can animate changes to this property’s value. See [doc://com.apple.scenekit/documentation/SceneKit/animating-scenekit-content].

## Working with Material Property Contents

- **contents**: The visual contents of the material property—a color, image, or source of animated content. Animatable.
